title: PHPchroot()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPchroot()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Change the root directory:
<?php
// Change root directory
chroot("/path/to/chroot/");
// Get current directory
echo getcwd();
?>
Result:
/
Definition and Usage
The chroot() function changes the root directory of the current process to
directory
, and changes the current working directory to "/".
Note:
This function requires root privileges, and is only 
available to GNU and BSD systems, and only when using the CLI, CGI or Embed 
SAPI.
Note:
This function is not implemented on Windows platforms.
Syntax
chroot(
directory
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
directory
Required. Specifies the path to change the root directory to
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE on success. FALSE on failure.
PHP Version:
4.0.5+

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
// Change root directory
chroot("/path/to/chroot/");
// Get current directory
echo getcwd();
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPchroot()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPchroot()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPchroot()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
